page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT IN LONGTOWN.
page.content: Many inhabitants of Longtown have to travel to Carlisle to their place of work.The town itself has insufficient employment to offer jobs for all.Of those people who earn their living locally,some are in the retail trade;a significant number in the transport industry, a similar number work in a local M.O.D. establishment.With the area being predominately rural,some workers find employment in farming,though most local farms are worked by father/son partnerships. Traditional apprenticeships for school-leavers are scarce,and many young people join YTS schemes to experience their first paid employment.Young people generally are reluctant to leave the area,and do not enter further education.Some do however, join the armed services to find stable employment.
